thread.title: Saban praises A&M crowd: '(Kyle Field) is the kind of place (Bryant-Denny) should be'
thread.title_full: Saban praises A&M crowd: '(Kyle Field) is the kind of place (Bryant-Denny) should be'

title: Saban praises A&M crowd: '(Kyle Field) is the kind of place (Bryant-Denny) should be'
text:
Saban praises A&M crowd: '(Kyle Field) is the kind of place (Bryant-Denny) should be' 
Saban came away impressed with the atmosphere in College Station. Troy Taormina / USA TODAY Sports Oct 22, 2015 at 10:57p ET 0Shares 
Alabama continues to roll on the field, as the Tide won its fourth consecutive game and overtook Texas A&M in the SEC West standing by winning in College Station 41-23. Despite the dominant victory, Alabama's head coach found a way to potentially upgrade his own homefield advantage. 
Following his first game inside the recently renovated Kyle Field, Nick Saban had nothing but positive remarks regarding the atmosphere and Aggie crowd in attendance during his latest radio show. 
“You talk about loud,” Saban said. “You talk about affecting the game. I mean, their fans really did affect the game, and it says a lot about our players to keep their poise and focus.” 
Saban even appeared to challenge the Bryant-Denny fans with his comments. 
“I hope our fans can hear this,” Saban said, “because this is the kind of place we should be.” MORE NEWS: Want stories delivered to you? Sign up for our College Football newsletters. 0
